item.title: Wuthering Waves: How to Unlock Mt. Firmament
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get to Mt. Firmament
  • What to Expect in Mt.Firmament
  • How to Leave Mt.Firmament

The latest update for Wuthering Wave s , Thaw of Eons, introduces an exciting new area to Huanglong’s map: Mt. Firmament. This snowy region, located south of Jinzhou, becomes visible after downloading the patch. However, reaching it isn't straightforward since it's situated far out in the ocean. As you might have guessed, a special quest unlocks access to this new region and introduces some fresh Resonators. Fortunately, the quest is fairly short. If you’ve already completed the first five acts of the first chapter, you’ll have no trouble venturing into Mt. Firmament.

How to Get to Mt. Firmament

  • Complete the Rewinding Raindrops quest.
  • Complete the A New Companion and Dreamy Scents quests.
  • Start the "To Mt. Firmament" quest in Jinzhou.

To unlock Mt. Firmament, you need to complete the “A New Companion” main quest. This quest becomes available after you finish Rewinding Raindrops, which occurs during the fifth act of Chapter One.

In the A New Companion quest, you will meet Abby, also known as the "Little One." Following this, the quest will lead you to the Dreamy Scents objective and subsequently to the "To Mt. Firmament" objective, which ultimately guides you to Mt. Firmament.

You will need to ride a ferryboat to access Mt. Firmament as there’s no other access. You will also meet Changli before getting into the new area. She will accompany you through the new objectives at this location.

What to Expect in Mt.Firmament

Starting with the To Mt. Firmament mission, a new questline awaits you in this location. You will also be able to hunt down new Echo types as well as new collectibles such as Windchimers. Mt. Firmament is almost as vast as Norfall Barrens, offering a wide area to explore, including some underground tunnels.

Mt. Firmament has seven primary regions: Luminous Shore, Xuanji Ridges, Loong’s Rest, Loong’s Crest, Loong’s Ridge, Tianqu Tree, and Hongzhen. All these areas will be accessible from the get-go once the player enters the island. Mt. Firmament also provides a chance for you to test the new Resonators: Jinhsi and Changli. You will be able to play as them during the first main quest on the island.

How to Leave Mt.Firmament

The only way to leave Mt. Firmament is by fast traveling to another Resonance Nexus or Beacon. Once you activate the first Nexus station on the island, you can travel back and forth between Huanglong cities and Mt. Firmament Island.

item.title: Elden Ring: 7 Best Sorceries For Bosses, Ranked
item.description:
With the Shadow of the Erdtree now available, there are Sorceries that can be used to defeat bosses in the base game before reaching the requirement to access the DLC. These spells can be used to defeat the bosses with the utmost precision and efficiency, ranging from offensive to utility to defensive types of spells.

Each of them are unique and although these spells can be used conjointly with each other, one can solely be powerful enough to help the players take down even the fiercest Elden Ring boss from the longest distance, to even the shortest distance with their unique magic effect and power.

7 Carian Slicer

Fast-Slashing Melee Spell With High Damage

  • Can be boosted by the Carian Glintstone Staff.
  • Four FP cost
  • 14 Int requirement

Carian Slicer has the highest magic damage per FP ratio out of all other spells, making it this spell one of the highest DPS outputs in the game when properly optimized, although it comes with the cost of poise damage and flexibility of moveset. The spell conjures a magic sword and delivers a swift slash repeatedly.

This sorcery can be used with no delay after performing other actions. Carian Slicer can be parried like a melee attack and can be used like a melee weapon for running, jumping, rolling, and backstep attacks, as it has the same animation, but at a faster startup than a normal cast.

6 Adula Moonblade

Cold Magic Greatsword Conjuration Slash

  • Dropped by the Glintstone Dragon Adula located at the Cathedral of Manus Celes.
  • Has 22 FP cost
  • 32 Int requirement
  • Initial slash and projectile deals 3 times of Sorcery Scaling as magic damage
  • Can be boosted by Carian Glintstone Staff

Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost that can be cast repeatedly. Adula Moonblade has a chain move that increases the activation speed repeatedly, making it quicker than before.

When hitting an enemy with both the slash of the blade and the projectile, the powerful Adula Moonblade damage can be maximized along with the frostbite buildup, although it only works on the first cast.

5 Carian Phalanx

Enhanced Version Of Magic Glintblade

  • Fires nine glint blades dealing magic damage four times amount of Sorcery Scaling
  • Can be boosted by the Carian Glintblade Staff
  • Sold at Seluvis's Rise by Preceptor Seluvis, complete steps of his questline until after handing the Amber Starlight item

Carian Phalanx creates multiple magic glint blades overhead which attack any approaching enemies. Phalanx spells are a good way for mages to wear down bosses' stance. The blades will break upon coming into contact with any geometry and terrain, including enemies, making it one of the most powerful sorceries.

Unfortunately, this means players cannot prepare themselves with the spell before going through the fog gate. To not accidentally break the blades on any surfaces, proceed carefully and take caution, so players don't waste any damage.

4 Thops’ Barrier

Defensive Spell That Reflect Any Magic Projectiles

  • Has no FP cost.
  • Six start-up frames and four parry frames doubled at 60 fps
  • Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab after delivering the spare Academy Glintstone Key to Thops at Church of Irith

Erect a magical forcefield while swinging the shield to deflect sorceries and incantations. It can also be used in the same way as a regular parry. Thops Barrier is a great defensive spell for any spellcaster build, unlike ashes of war deflecting skills that are equipped on shields, Thops Barrier doesn’t have any FP costs and can be cast using any staff.

Without the limitation of being stuck with a shield, Thops Barrier grants players extra slots and lighter equipment load overall. Thops Barrier can be easily spammable without any downsides, and perfect with Radagon Icon talisman that fastens Thops Barrier cooldown between casts.

3 Freezing Mist

Lingering Mist With Heavy Frostbite Buildup

  • Has a short area radius and range, covers wider area when charged
  • Inflict 120 Frost buildup on enemies
  • Can be bought from Preceptor Seluvis for 6,000 Runes. Seluvis is located in Seluvis's Rise, inside the Three Sisters region of Liurnia of the Lakes.

Releases a cold mist before the caster. This sorcery can be cast while in motion and charging it enhances the range of the mist. Freezing Mist can give players lingering additional tick damage while dealing damage to bosses through any other means.

The tick damage seems little at first, but it can be game changing with its continuous frostbite buildup, which inflicts percentage hp damage and amplifies damage taken when the frost bite occurs.

2 Founding Rain Of Stars

Lingering Spell That Deals Heavy Damage

  • Inside a chest within Heretical Rise, in Mountaintops of the Giants. Players have to access the location via an invisible bridge starting from the other side of the ravine, and advance following a white mist that indicates the safe path.
  • 31 Stamina cost
  • Short AOE radius
  • Can’t stagger enemies

Summons a dark cloud of stars overhead and shortly after, the cloud will release a violent deluge of star rain. This sorcery can be cast while in motion and can be charged to increase potency. The Founding Rain of Stars can be used as a lingering additional damage dealer while the players going for other action.

Due to its potency when cast to have a multiple instances of the spell, the Founding Rain of Stars is best suited for large type of bosses, such as dragons, as it deals extra damage to them.

1 Ranni’s Dark Moon

Charged Moon With Magic Defense Reduction

  • 57 FP Cost
  • Two Slots used
  • 68 Intelligence requirement

Ranni’s Dark Moon deals Magic damage, and will build Frostbite (270) on vulnerable enemies. One cast is normally all it takes to apply the Frost. In addition to frostbite, the sorcery also applies a debuff which reduces magic negation by 10% for 60 seconds.

If the spell triggers frostbite on the target, it reduces damage negation by more than 20%. The total damage negation reduction multiplicative stacks to 32%. Regardless of the target's base negation. It will always increase magic damage by 10%. While it may have incredibly high damage, Ranni's Dark Moon has a long casting animation and can be canceled if struck by a boss' attack before the projectile launches.

item.title: World Of Warcraft: Cataclysm Classic - The Best New Recipes For Illustrious Alchemists
item.description:
Highlights

  • New Illustrious Grand Master Alchemy recipes offer gear, accessories, and consumables in World of Warcraft: Cataclysm.
  • Alchemy involves potions, elixirs, gem transformations, crafting Alchemy stones, and skill-grinding recipes.
  • Potions and elixirs offer health, mana restoration, increased spirit, enemy damage, and armor boosts.

The higher profession levels in World of Warcraft: Cataclysm means a whole new list of recipes for gear, accessories, and consumables. Alchemists, who use a mix of herbs, magical items, and even fish to make a variety of concoctions, can now reach the new Illustrious Grand Master level.

Alchemy is about making potions and elixirs primarily, but the profession also involves gem transmutations, crafting Alchemy stones, and there's even a recipe for an Epic mount. Some of these can be used to grind the Alchemy skill while others can only be made at maximum level.

7 Mysterious Potion

Not All That Mysterious, But Very Useful

  • Alchemy Level: 470
  • Ingredients Required: Deepstone Oil
  • Effects: Restores zero to 50000 health and zero to 20000 mana

The only thing that's really "mysterious" about this potion is exactly how much health or mana it will restore, or any at all. It's possible that this weird potion won't restore anything, but that usually isn't the case, and it's rare and wonderful to find any kind of potion that restores both of them at this level.

Deepstone Oil is made from the Albino Cavefish, which is found in the underwater reaches of Deepholm, so visit the Fishing trainer on the way to the Alchemist. It's an important ingredient in several other recipes besides this one.

6 Ghost Elixir

Handy For Priests, Warlocks, And Other Spellcasters

  • Alchemy Level: 450
  • Ingredients Required: Cinderbloom
  • Effects: Increases Spirit by 225 for an hour

The recipe for Ghost Elixir is one the first that most new Illustrious Grand Master Alchemists learn, and it's an ideal choice to start the grind. Spirit is the stat that regenerates mana, which means any casting class can use it, and it only requires a single ingredient.

Cinderbloom is a common ingredient in several Alchemy recipes, and Herbalists can acquire it in places like Mount Hyjal and some places in the Twilight Highlands. It's one of the cheaper materials to buy if one's character isn't a Herbalist or just doesn't feel like farming.

5 Deathblood Venom

Primarily For Melee Fighters

  • Alchemy Level: 455
  • Ingredients Required: Stormvine
  • Effects: Has a chance to poison enemies that hit you in melee combat with 2000 damage for 8 seconds.

A potion that most Alchemists see as a mere leveling tool, mainly because it only requires a single ingredient and is one of the earliest recipes new Illustrious Grand Masters learn. Stormvine is available in several locations and isn't expensive if players want to purchase it, so this is partly true.

On the other hand, this is a very useful potion for any character who wants an edge in melee combat. For tanks that want some extra offensive powers against multiple enemies, this potion can mean the difference between life and death.

4 Volcanic Potion

Ideal For Any Class That Uses The Intellect Stat

  • Alchemy Level: 460
  • Ingredients Required: Cinderbloom, Azshara's Veil
  • Effects: Increases Intellect by 1200 for 25 seconds

Warlocks and Mages are the primary beneficiaries of the Volcanic Potion's benefits, so even if the Alchemist making these can't use them they're still a valuable trade item. It's a niche market that appeals mostly to raiders, so drop a few in the guild bank just for the social credit.

Other reasons to start with this potion include that it only requires two herbs and a fairly low skill level. After making a few Ghost Elixirs to grind up the skill, the Alchemist can move on to the Volcanic Potion with some of the leftover Cinderbloom.

3 Potion Of Illusion

Just For The Fun Of It

  • Alchemy Level: 460
  • Ingredients Required: Volatile Life, Azshara's Veil
  • Effects: Changes your character to a different race for 2 minutes

It's not the easiest potion to make, with the ingredients being a mix of rare herbs and volatile elements, but it's hard to resist another magical potion even if it doesn't grant any combat benefits. All this potion does is turn the player's 'toon into another Azerothian race for two minutes, and that can include those of the opposite faction.

Volatile Life is one of the easier elemental ingredients to find, especially for Miners and Herbalists, because it drops from their farming nodes. Another option is to purchase it, and it's by far the most inexpensive of all the new volatile elements.

2 Elixir Of The Deep Earth

  • Alchemy Level: 475
  • Ingredients Required: Heartblossom
  • Effects: Increases armor class by 900 for an hour

It sounds like something a player would learn in Deepholm, but it's easily learned from an Alchemy trainer. It's ideal for tanks and melee fighters that bear the brunt of physical damage, but casters can use it too, and healers can always use some extra armor.

The Elixir of the Deep Earth is a common addition to most leveling guides. It only requires one ingredient to make, other than the usual Crystal Vial, and if the Alchemist can't use it themselves, it's worth something at the Auction House.

1 Deepstone Oil

An Essential Ingredient For A Rare Mount

  • Alchemy Level: 470
  • Ingredients Required: Albino Cavefish
  • Effects: Officially, it "may cause stiffness" but there are various random effects.

File this under the category for Rare Mounts as well, and it's interesting how an Alchemy recipe became an essential component in one of the game's most difficult mounts to find. Deepstone Oil by itself is one of those quirky potions that have a random effect, similar to the Noggenfogger Elixir, but it's also used to make the Epic-quality recipe, Vial Of the Sands.

The Vial Of the Sands doesn't just summon a mount, it turns the player into a mount. Specifically, it turns the player into a flying dragon that can carry another player with them. No other mount in the game is like this, and the recipe is an extremely rare find connected to the Archeology profession.

item.title: Palia: How to Get Heat Root
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find Heat Root in Palia
  • How to Use Heat Root in Palia

There are many spices in Palia that can be used for cooking, or for other uses such as completing Bundles or providing villagers with their requested items. Some of these spices are quite difficult to locate, however, which can make it hard for players to finish up their required tasks quickly.

If you are struggling to locate some Heat Roots in particular, this guide will provide you with some of its frequent locations. This spice is one of the rarest in the game, so you will most likely be spending a bit of time foraging through the Bahari Bay map.

Where to Find Heat Root in Palia

Although the Heat Root is very rare in Palia , there are a few locations where you can find the cooking ingredient consistently. They will frequently appear on cliffsides in the Bahari Bay map only. Wherever there is a mountain, you can check the sides to see if you can spot a Heat Root.

However, since they are rare, there is one particular location where we have found it most frequently: on the cliffsides near the Statue Garden and Coral Shores . You can use the above map image as a reference to where we found a couple in those areas.

If you just look above you on the mountainside, you'll see a glowing orange spot that will be the Heat Root. You can either climb the mountain and grab it on your way up, or if you are already on top, you can get it on your way down. Though this spice is considered rare, they are actually relatively easy to find since they glow and stand out against the gray rocks.

How to Use Heat Root in Palia

Once you have some Heat Roots in your inventory, there are a variety of things you can use them for. This includes:

  • Used to complete the Sear-chef Bundle
  • Used to complete the following quests :
    • Mysterious Brew
    • Powering Through
    • Search and Seizure
    • Underground Affairs

  • Can be sold for 60-90 Gold (Not recommended)
  • Can be gifted to villagers
  • Can be used to craft a Phoenix Firework
  • Can be used to cook :
    • Chapaa Masala
    • Oysters Akwinduu
    • Poke Bowl
    • Spicy Rice Cakes
    • Sushi

  • Can be used to make a Short or Tall Enchanted Candle

As you can see, there are a lot of uses for the Heat Root, so you will want to make sure you save the ones you get for completing important quests and the Sear-chef Bundle . Then, you can use any remaining ones you have to create some great dishes, like a simple batch of Sushi, or some delicious Chapaa Masala.

item.title: Palia: How to Catch Black Sea Bass
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find Black Sea Bass in Palia
  • How to Catch Black Sea Bass in Palia

In the world of Palia , there are plenty of fish in the sea that players can catch. Some of these are much more common, like a Yellow Perch or an Albino Eel, or they can be incredibly rare, like a Long Nosed Unicorn Fish. Although you might think that all common fish are easy to get, some have additional prerequisites that you must meet. To get a Black Sea Bass, for example, you won't be able to just fish in any body of water to get it. Instead, there is a particular process you will need to follow to get the creature on your line.

Where to Find Black Sea Bass in Palia

To get started with looking for a Black Sea Bass in Palia , you will only be able to find it on one map: Bahari Bay . Specifically, this fish will be found along the coast of Bahari Bay, in the ocean on the right side. This ranges all the way from Statue Garden to Windy Ruins.

Unfortunately, this fish cannot be found in Kilima Valley, so you will need to stick to the Bahari Bay map to reel it in. Along the coast, there is no specific spot where the Black Sea Bass more frequently appear, so you can pick any location you prefer, whether you wish to fish near The Old Lighthouse, or want to take a trip to Coral Shores instead.

How to Catch Black Sea Bass in Palia

Here is where things get more complicated. Although the Black Sea Bass is easy to locate in Palia , as it is found in a whole entire ocean, it is not as easy to catch as you might think. There are a few things you will need to bring along, otherwise you will be pulling in different fish that are more common. Here is what you need to do:

  • You can use just about any fishing rod to catch the Black Sea Bass, especially since it is a common fish.
  • You must use Glow Worm bait to catch the Black Sea Bass, even though it is common. It will not appear otherwise.
  • The Black Sea Bass will appear at any time during the day or night.

It might seem strange for a common fish to require Glow Worms, but this is the only way to get the Black Sea Bass. Glow Worms can only be obtained through a Glow Worm Farm at level 7 , or purchased through Einar's Fishing Guild Store once you reach fishing level 10 , costing 10 Fishing Medals. If you want to get the Glow Worm Farm recipe, you can also get it from the Fishing Guild Store for 2,000 Gold.

To make Glow Worms in your Glow Worm Farm, you can throw in just about any item, like apples or even some butter . Once you have some Glow Worms, return to the Bahari Bay coast and the Black Sea Bass should appear very quickly.
